questions.text: Who was lying on the ground on the street in the cold opening?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	He was lying on the ground so Sam could park there. Everyone thought there was something wrong with Woody, especially since he was yelling, "Don't move me, don't move me!"

questions.text: What did Carla say was cursed?
questions.explanation:
Foosball table.

	Carla said bad things happened to people who use it. She warned everyone to stay away from it, but no one was listening to her.

questions.text: Who said he was in therapy for the first time in his life?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam was still having a problem with Hill. It had gotten so bad Sam had to see a therapist about it. Sam was sleeping with said therapist.

questions.text: What did Sam make the check out to John Hill as?
options: John "you're going to pay for this" Hill
questions.explanation:
John "you stink" Hill.

	Sam told Hill's daughter (at the time he didn't know it was his daughter) that it was just meant to be between him and Hill and he didn't mean anything by it. His daughter said, "and all the people at the bank."

questions.text: What was the name of Hill's daughter?
questions.explanation:
Valerie.

	Valerie was played by Valerie Mahaffey, who was born in Indonesia. She introduced herself to Sam as "Valerie 'you stink' Hill".

questions.text: Who did Sam have in tears?
questions.explanation:
John Hill.

	When Hill found out Sam was dating his daughter, it brought him to tears. He agreed to give Sam the pool room and the bathrooms if he'd stay away from Valerie. Sam agreed and got the rooms back.

questions.text: Did Sam want to date Hill's daughter after he agreed not to?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	Sam told Woody he wanted her. Then he tried to figure out a plan so he could see her again and not lose his pool room and bathrooms.

questions.text: Why did Rebecca say Sam wanted her?
options: He was horny all the time.
He had a goal to sleep with as many woman in Boston as possible.
He thought she was beautiful and couldn't imagine living without her.
questions.explanation:
He couldn't have her.

	Rebecca said that the fact that she couldn't have Valerie was the same reason he wanted her. Rebecca seems to think Sam is only interested in women he can't have. Perhaps, she is right.

questions.text: Whose arm got stuck in the Foosball table?
questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	Frasier was trying to prove her wrong about the foosball table being cursed when he got his arm caught in the table. Carla called her priest to release the demons from the table, but all the priest did was pulled Frasier's arm out of table.

questions.text: Who thought the note Sam wrote was for him?
questions.explanation:
Reuben.

	He wrote Valerie a note about going away for the weekend. Reuben got the note and thought it was for him. He was heartbroken when he found out Sam didn't want to take him out after all.
